text: MIDI quantization in clips allows you to make small or large corrections to
timing of notes that have been recorded in live. In this video we're going to
take a look at how you can use MIDI quantization. In track one I have a drum
loop playing from a clip that I recorded earlier. Let's expand the detail view to
have a look at the notes recorded. As you can see most of the notes are slightly
behind in their timing according to the grid. So to correct the timing of
individual notes I can simply click and hold on the note and move that closer to
the grid. This is a great quantizing method to use if you only have a few
notes that need slight corrections in their timing. However if I want to
quantize several MIDI notes at the same time within a clip then there's a much
more efficient method to use. So let's start another clip and have a look at
this. You can apply the quantization to a selection or the entire clip. In this
case I'll apply it to the entire clip. Rather than moving the individual notes
this time I'll right-click and go to quantize settings. The first setting
quantize to allows me to set the resolution of the quantization. Adjust
note allows me to apply quantization to the start or the end or even both the
start and end of my MIDI notes. The amount slider allows me to select by how
much I'd like the quantization to affect the notes. 100% being full
quantization and 0% being no quantization. Once I click OK all of the
notes will be quantized as you can see in the detail view and you can also hear
in the feel of the rhythm. In the next clip I'll apply quantization with a
slightly lower amount to see what happens. In this clip I'll right-click
and go to quantize settings and rather than set the quantize to 100% I'll set
it to 35 and then apply it to the clip. In this clip the MIDI notes weren't
moved as much as in the previous clip and you can also hear that the feeling of
the actual original groove hasn't been so strongly corrected. By experimenting
with the quantization amount you can find a good balance between the original
timing and making minor corrections where necessary.
The third method of quantization is to use quantization while recording your
MIDI notes. To do this go to the edit menu and select record quantization. Here
you can choose the resolution of quantization you'd like to apply while
recording your notes. Once this is selected all notes that are recorded in
clips will be quantized as they're recorded.
